Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Likely got a splinter. Can't figure what to do without Mama here to pull it out for him.

Speaker: boone
Dialogue: Need a doc, Captain?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Gather more wood.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Shame my Pap was a broken down drunk. Else he could've bought me a Captain's job too.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Glass and the others will be back with some game, Fitzgerald. Just make sure you have the fires ready.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: My supper's in the hands of a hermit nigger, a kid and a dummy. Hell, my belly feels full already.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: But bigger than we figured. Gonna be a load to haul back to camp.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Have to split it up I reckon.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Yep. Bridger'll take the tail, and Pig you haul the rest.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Another one close by?

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Hugh?

Speaker: boone
Dialogue: No rule says I'm the only one that's gotta gather this shit.

Speaker: trapper
Dialogue: `REE!

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: GET TO THE BOAT!

Speaker: trapper
Dialogue: WAIT!

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: What's the plan, Captain?

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: We're just floatin' farther from Fort Union.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: The Missouri's no good. Not if the `Ree's running it.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: So we just float the hell down to Mexico or wherever else this river takes us?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: We get ourselves safe outta range, then track another course up.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Add weeks to the trip.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Better that than endin' up scalped on the side of the river.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Shut up, kid, you don't get no say in this.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I understand our situation, Mr. Fitzgerald. We do like Glass said... put some distance between us and the Arikara, then chart a course to Fort Union.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Reckon it's better `an lettin' the `Ree find him... take his ears... slice what's left all to shit.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: So we hike west to the Grand, then follow it up to Fort Union.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: On foot? You got any idea how long that's gonna take? It'll be winter before we get there.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: Unless we come across a post... trade for some horses.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: No posts that far out.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: So if we do this, we do every step with our own feet.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We make camp here for the night, then load supplies and head out for the Grand at first light.  And gather extra blankets `cause there won't be any fires.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Thank you... for what you done back there.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: You'd have done the same for me.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: You treat that Anstadt sweeter than any woman, Glass.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: Never seen a woman that could stop a `Ree from three hundred feet.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: I knew a particular big-breasted redhead in Boston that might come close.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Bring it over here for me to have a look.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: You seen it before.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: What'd you say, kid?

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I said you shoulda already got a look when he saved you with it earlier.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: You're lucky you ain't a man yet.  Else that mighta nicked somethin'.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Middle of workin' on it.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Well you can stop workin' on it, and let me have a look like I said.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Best I can tell, my place is right where I want it... on the smart end of my rifle.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I'd be careful if I was you, boy.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: That's enough, Fitzgerald. Go sober up and get to sleep.  If you're passed out when we break camp tomorrow, I leave you here.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: That's the trouble with this part of the world. No mirrors. Niggers forget what color they are.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Can't sleep either?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Never like closin' my eyes when I'm not sure who'll be standin' over me when I open `em.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I keep thinking about Boone and the others... how maybe I should've had us make camp further up river.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: The tracks I saw... those `Ree had been tailin' us for a while. They'd have gone as far north as it took.  You're a good man, Captain. Soon as you realize that, these others will too.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Your years trappin' and guidin' out here... have you had much experience with the Arikara?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Enough to try and stay outta their way.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: But you know this country well enough to get us past them... up to Fort Union?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I been here a long while. Whether that gets us to Union or not...

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: What Fitzgerald said earlier... he doesn't speak for the rest.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: He wasn't wrong. Truth is that's what I prefer about this country... it's got no eye for the color of a man's skin.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Try to get some sleep, Hugh.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: Shouldn't we have hit the Grand by now?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We'll reach it soon enough. Glass said to keep this course.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Glass said. Too bad I don't see him.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: That's on account he's up ahead makin' sure it's clear, and you get to keep your ears.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Or he's run off and left us.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: He wouldn't do that.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: My bet, that nigger's used to runnin'.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: UP AHEAD!

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Christ Almighty.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Glass!

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: HUGH!

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: He's down here!

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: He's tore to pieces.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: Least he took that Grizz down with him.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Wished he'da done it without firing his rifle. If there wasn't no `Ree around before, there will be now.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: THAT'S ENOUGH!

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Holy Christ, he's alive.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Get me some water.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Oh, Jesus... Jesus.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: It's okay, Hugh.  You're going to be fine.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: What about me, Cap?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Get down here and help me tie off these wounds best we can.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: It won't stop bleedin'.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Shut up, Pig.  We're fixing you up, Hugh.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: It's gonna be fine, Mr. Glass.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Roll him over... easy.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: What about the rest of him?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: He's losing more blood back here.  And I don't know what to do with that yet.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: They're torturin' the poor bastard.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: And riskin' gettin' us killed in the process. Proper thing would be to end it for him quick.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: `Less he could pull through.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: You seen what that grizz did to him. Shit, Glass'll be dead inside a hour. We all will be if he keeps screamin' like that.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: What now?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We wait. Does he have any kin you know of?

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: He keeps to hisself. Never mentioned none.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Go get the others. Tell `em we're making camp here for the night.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: It ain't for me.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: I can feel some air outta his mouth. Maybe Captain sealed up his throat proper, huh?  Whatta you figure his odds are, Jim?

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Long.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: What that bear did to him... I didn't expect he'd last this long.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: I seen a fella go a week once after a lion jumped him. Fever finally finished him off.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: Whatta we do, Cap?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We give him his chance.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: You ain't doin' him or us no favors, Captain, lettin' him suffer that way.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: Fever's hit. Won't be long now.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I seen a bad one drag on days.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: We keep sittin' here watchin' him die, only gives the `Ree more chance to find us.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: He's burnin', Cap. Water turns to boil as soon as it touches him.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Pig, take Anderson and scout ahead. Grand should be just west of here. Find us the best route.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Tryin' to buy Glass time don't make sense for the rest of us, Captain.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Get movin'.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Least it's a step in the right direction.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Any coyote digs that deep deserves the meal.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Found it, Cap. Right where Glass had us headed.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: No more than a mile or so out.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We could build a litter. Haul him with us.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: It's rocky and steep goin'.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Marshy and thick on the other side. We could try it, but...

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I signed on as a trapper, not a goddamn mule.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Shape he's in... I don't see no way he'd make bein' drug.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Lay that rag over his eyes, Mr. Bridger.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: But, Captain.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Do it.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I'll stay with him... money or not.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Same here.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I can't let you stay back, Pig. Without Glass, I'll need you to scout.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Two won't stand much chance against a party of `Ree, Captain, and seventy dollars won't buy me a new setta ears.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: A hundred then.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: They can have my share too. I owe Glass that at least.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: That case I'll hang back with the kid. I don't mind fallin' a day or so behind for two hundred.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: But Glass is to be cared for until. Understood?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I'll let the young doctor do his job.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: The rest gather your gear.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: I'll see ya at Fort Union, Hugh.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: As long as necessary.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I'll look after him.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I'll take first watch.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Not with his rifle.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Trust me, kid, he ain't gonna be needin' it tonight.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: You were right to protect this.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: When are you gonna die, boy?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Don't you ever question me, you little piss-ant.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Keep quiet. I was down at the creek... there's twenty of `em at least, comin' this way.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Oh, shit. Whatta we do?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: We run. Now.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: What about Glass?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: He's on his own, same as us.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I can't leave him.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Then I'm talkin' to a dead man.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: What're you doin'? He needs that.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: He couldn't hold it if you tarred it to his hands.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: It's his goddamn rifle! That's all he's got!

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: And more than he'll need.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: We can't leave him with nothin'.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: We ran the better part of six hours. Had to gain some ground on Henry and them others.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Best douse that smoke before them `Ree spot it.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: We put enough distance between us and them. And it's too damn cold to go without one.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: All we know, they hoofed it through the night same as us.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: A dozen `Ree can't make the time us two did.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: It was twenty earlier.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: What?

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: When you woke me... you said you'd spotted twenty `Ree.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: A dozen... twenty. I wasn't in a mood to count feathers. Hell, one `Ree woulda been too many.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: What was you even doin' down at the creak in the middle of the night?  I'd already brought plenty a water.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Don't start questionin' me on accounta you feelin' guilty `bout leavin' your nigger buddy behind.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: ANSWER ME OR I BLOW YOUR DAMN HEAD OFF!

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: What're you askin'? Why it was you turned your back on Glass? Why you let him die to save your own sorry skin?  `Cause you was scared shitless, that's why.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: The `Ree... did you see `em?  DID YOU SEE `EM?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Not a one.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I'm goin' back for him.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Far as we ran all night, you couldn't find Glass with dogs and a map. And I don't believe you really want to. `Cause after leavin' him to die the first time, I doubt he'd be too happy to see you now.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Griz-lee.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: `Bout goddamn time.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Twice the folks here than when we left.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: We should go see Captain Henry.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Far as we hiked... we got time for a drink on the company's tab.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: If your fat ass could get through, we didn't have no worries.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: Had to be a helluva long walk for you.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I hope not.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Maybe we best go see Henry, kid. I just got a itch to spend the first of my two-hundred.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I won't pretend to been his friend, but I respect any man that fights the way he done.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: And the grave?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: We had those extra days so we went deeper... covered it in rocks. To keep the scavengers off him.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Any sign of hostiles?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Not a one.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Glad to hear you pulled your weight, Mr. Bridger. I knew you would.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: More than his share, Captain.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Speaking of shares.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Fortunate for me, it did not.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Well thank you both for your courage and honor. You have done yourselves proud.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: He's beat hisself up most of the trip... wishin' he'da done more.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We all saw the shape Glass was in. There was no more to be done.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: That's what I been tellin' him.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: How many suns? Ten?

Speaker: boys
Dialogue: Tatanka Wicasa.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: You speak English.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Need words when trade with whites.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Well I'm grateful for you bringing me here... havin' them care for me.  Now if you could point me which way it is you do your tradin'... with the whites.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Whites. Bra-zo.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Fort Brazeau? That's where I'm tryin' to get. Is it far from here?

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Not walk. Hides soon.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: The men stole my rifle.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Red Hawk ask who kill griz-lee.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Grizzly?

Speaker: red hawk
Dialogue: Arikara.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: He say Arikara take right ear of Sioux. Left ear of whites. Not know what they take from you.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Buff-A-lo Man hunt with Sioux?

Speaker: three feathers
Dialogue: Tatanka Wicasa.

Speaker: boys
Dialogue: Tatanka Wicasa! Tatanka Wicasa!

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Thank you.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Good hunt.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Yes.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: You. Fam-i-lee?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: No wom-an?  Wakayaja?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: No. Not for a long time.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Tatanka Wicasa.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Nice.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Nice.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: No... please.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: We go.

Speaker: brazeau
Dialogue: We make good trades then.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Good to see you again, Mr. Brazeau.

Speaker: brazeau
Dialogue: Jesus Christ, what happened to your goddamned face?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Had a tussle with a grizzly.

Speaker: brazeau
Dialogue: And now the grizzly, he don't look so good either, eh?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: They looked after me for a spell. I'm on my way to catch back up with Captain Henry... at Fort Union. Needed to trade for some supplies on the Company's credit if I could.

Speaker: brazeau
Dialogue: Oui, of course. Anything you like.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: We can start with this.

Speaker: brazeau
Dialogue: You can pick up the horse at the livery in the morning.  I wish I could give you a room for the night, but...

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Won't be the last night I sleep on the ground.

Speaker: brazeau
Dialogue: Take care of that face, Glass.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: You stay here tonight?

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: Your people?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: You come then.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Fort Union.

Speaker: spotted horse
Dialogue: You spend your life hunting enemy. Enemy wins.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: It will be over soon.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I had enough of this cold as hell shit.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: What'd you figure when ya signed on outta that St. Louis whorehouse you was workin'? That you was headin' off to paradise?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I tell ya what I figured, I figured I'd be somewhere the piss wouldn't freeze before I got it outta my pecker.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Figured wrong.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Waste a time to check traps in this weather... while Henry sits warmin' his ass on the stove in his office.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: Why don't you go tell him that, Fitz? Then start your hike back to St. Louie.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Shit, I walked up here, I got no problem walkin' back.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: Contracted for twelve months. We all did.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Henry can shove that contract up his toasty warm ass, or I'll do it for him.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: Just give that fat little whore you're so sweet on a couple extra bits... she'll have you thinkin' it's Spring already.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Hello? Captain?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: To the river, Murphy.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: That you, Fitzgerald?

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Left my rifle down there... don't want it out all night.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: That weren't too smart.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Just don't take a shot at me when I come back in.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: We'll see.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Not that you'd hit me if you tried.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I'm Hugh Glass of...

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: We don't serve niggers.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Of the Rocky Mountain Fur Company on my way to Fort Union.

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: I don't care if you was with Lewis and Clark headed for the new world. We don't serve niggers.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: All I need is a horse and enough supplies to...

Speaker: trapper
Dialogue: Ice musta froze up his ears, `cause he ain't listenin' to you, Cees.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: ...to get me to Fort Union. I can sign a draft made good by Captain Henry.

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: What the fuck happened to your face, boy? You try to slice all the black off?

Speaker: fat trapper
Dialogue: Best get on your way, boy.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I'm Hugh Glass of the Rocky Mountain Fur Company, and all I need is...

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: Do you believe this shit?

Speaker: fat trapper
Dialogue: Hell, I warned ya.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: All I need...

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: Shoot him, goddammit!

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: Shoot `em both!

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: Get after the son of a bitch!

Speaker: fat trapper
Dialogue: And he did say to put it all on the Rocky Mountain tab.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: Jesus Christ.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I'm sorry.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: You took everything I had... left me to die.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: I was scared of dyin'.  But every day since, I've wished I had.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: There wasn't no `Ree that night, was there?

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: No.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Hugh. Wait.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Where's Fitzgerald and my rifle?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Deserted two days ago. Along with about five hundred dollars of company money.  I wanna hear what happened.

Speaker: bridger
Dialogue: Wait. Please!

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I cut the shoes loose of her, and hiked over to Fort Talbot.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: Christ almighty.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: And you may hear from the fella there about a stoled horse and supplies charged to you.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: We'll take care of it. You should go settle in.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: There's a couple fair whores next door that'll ease the miles on ya, scars or not.

Speaker: anderson
Dialogue: Jesus, Murph.

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: I just meant I'd go roust one of `em for ya if you wanted.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: She can take the night off, but I wouldn't mind the use of her bed.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Go clear out a room. The rest head on back to bunk.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: I told ya I'd see ya up here. You remember that, Hugh?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I do, Pig. You must have a little gypsy in ya.

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: I'll see ya in the mornin'.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Can I talk you outta what you're planning?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Thank you for what you done for me... stitchin' me back together... givin' me a chance.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I'm offerin' you another right now... to stay here... let this thing go.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: He thinks he let me die. But he don't know that he's the one that's kept me alive... for the chance of findin' him... makin' him pay for what he done.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: The law will make Fitzgerald pay.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: You told me once that other men didn't think like him.  Do you, Captain?

Speaker: murphy
Dialogue: He said he was goin' to get his rifle...

Speaker: pig
Dialogue: And the Captain found the money gone.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I'll make my way down river. See what turns up.

Speaker: stubby bill
Dialogue: The kid's gone... gear and all. Musta slipped out before light.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: "Every day I think about what I done. I want to tell Pig and the others the truth but am afraid what they'll think of me. I look at Fitzgerald and want to kill him but am afraid to try. I am a coward and wish he hadn't been lyin about the Ree that night. I wish they had come and kilt us both."

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: If I run across the boy, I'll send him back your way.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Fitzgerald stole five hundred dollars. Rocky Mountain Fur Company wants him too.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I can do this on my own.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I know you can. But maybe you won't have to.

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: We ain't got no food to spare, friend, if that's what you're lookin' for.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Then what the hell have ya got?

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: Whiskey and blankets mostly. Weather's held back deliveries.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Gimme a couple bottles then. Goddamn ice shredded my boat. Been walkin' for two days.

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: Horses ain't cheap this time a year.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Whatever the price, Rocky Mountain Fur Company's good for it.

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: You're the second son of a bitch come in here makin' that claim. And the first one left a bad taste.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: That right? Well I don't know nothin' about that. Just that I need a horse.

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: So did this other fella. So he stole one... along with Lange's pistola.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Fine then, I'll pay cash for the horse. How much?

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: How `bout you pay for your friend's too.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Wasn't my friend.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Yeah, okay. I'll collect from him. How much?

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: How `bout we say eighty...  ...five.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: You boys are leavin' me with nothin'. Better be a helluva horse.

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: Pick of the litter.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: When I see who?

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: The black son of a bitch that robbed me. You tell him that.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Scarred up, you say... and headed up to Union?

Speaker: runty man
Dialogue: That's what he told us. Seemed real anxious to get there too.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I'll make sure to give him the message when I find him.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Hugh.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Ice tore it up.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: What's out that direction? Talbot?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: And the Missouri. Doubt he'd risk the river with the `Ree. Likely grab a horse, and cross over high... take his chances goin' east against the weather. When'd you say he skipped out?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Three days ago now.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: We best pick up our pace.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: This was Fitzgerald camped here?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Couple nights back. But these tracks aren't all his.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: He's travelin' with somebody?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Came in after. Prints are smooth. Mocassins.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: But you figure they're `Ree.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I don't figure nothin', Captain. But whoever it is, they're a good day behind Fitzgerald.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: You told me once you knew enough to keep away from the `Ree.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I do.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: You figure this is smart then?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: You're welcome to head back, Captain.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: What if we find Fitzgerald... and I ask you not to do this?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Don't ask me.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: `Ree?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Wait!

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: So much for stayin' quiet.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Guess you would've been better off on your own.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: We needed to pick up some time anyways.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: Whatta ya got?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Smoke.

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: What if it's `Ree?

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: Then we leave `em be... meet back up here.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Didn't figure an important man like you to be away from your stove on a night as cold as this, Captain. You lost?

Speaker: henry
Dialogue: I'm here to save your life.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: I done told you boys... I don't need savin' by you or nobody else.

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: You shouldn't a come.

Speaker: fitzgerald
Dialogue: Glass... please!

Speaker: glass
Dialogue: I am Tatanka Wicasa! I have killed whites and I have killed Arikara and I have killed grizzly! AND I WILL KILL YOU!
